content.text:
# Charles King (character actor)

| birth_place  = Hillsboro, Texas, U.S.
| death_date   =
| death_place  = Hollywood, California, U.S.
| occupation   = Actor
| yearsactive  = 1915–1956
}}
Charles Lafayette King (February 21, 1895 – May 7, 1957) was an American actor who appeared in more than 400 films between 1915 and 1956. King was born in Dallas, Texas, and died in Hollywood, California, from cirrhosis of the liver.

* Singing River (1921)
* A Motion to Adjourn (1921)
* The Black Bag (1922)
* Merry-Go-Round (1923)
